summary: Cornwall is a county in southwest England, known for its Celtic heritage and beautiful landscapes. It is located on the peninsula's western tip, surrounded by the Atlantic Ocean and English Channel. The county has a rich history, once part of the ancient kingdom of Dumnonia, and later became a center for tin and copper mining. Today, Cornwall is famous for its stunning coastline, with steep cliffs and rias (flooded river valleys). The largest town is Truro, and the county has a population of around 568,000. The Cornish language, once extinct, is being revived as part of the cultural heritage.
title: Cornwall
